 18554                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18555                                  ;
 18556                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 18557                                  ;
 18558                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 18559                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 18560                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18561                                  ;
 18562                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 18563                                  ;
 18564                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18565                                  
 18566                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18567                                  MovDOSHi:
 18568                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18569                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18570                                  	; ds = cs
 18571 000008EC E8D700                  	call	AllocHMA
 18572 000008EF 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 18573 000008F1 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 18574 000008F4 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18575                                  
 18576                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18577                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 18578                                  
 18579                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 18580                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18581                                  	
 18582                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18583 000008F6 E83400                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 18584                                  
 18585                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 18586                                  	
 18587                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18588                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18589                                  	;xor	di,di
 18590                                  	
 18591                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18592                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 18593                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18594                                  	; ds = cs
 18595 000008F9 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 18596 000008FD E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 18597                                  
 18598                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 18599                                  ;else
 18600                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 18601                                  ;
 18602                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 18603                                  ;
 18604                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18605                                  
 18606 00000900 E86102                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 18607 00000903 F8                      	clc
 18608                                  mdhx:
 18609 00000904 C3                      	retn

 18918                                  						;  BIOS code

 18920                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system

 18931                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 18932                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 18933                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 18934                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 18935                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 18936                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 18937                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 18938                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 18939                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 18940                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 18941                                  ;	  stub will go.
 18942                                  ;
 18943                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 18944                                  
 18945                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18946                                  update_arena:
 18947 0000097F 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 18948 00000980 57                      	push	di
 18949 00000981 51                      	push	cx
 18950 00000982 52                      	push	dx
 18951                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18952                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 18953                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18954                                  	; ds = cs 
 18955 00000983 C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 18956 00000987 4F                      	dec	di
 18957 00000988 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 18958                                  						;  before sysvar
 18959 00000989 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 18960                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 18961 0000098B 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 18962 00000990 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 18963 00000992 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 18964                                  
 18965                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 18966 00000994 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 18967 00000999 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 18968 0000099B 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 18969 0000099D 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 18970 0000099F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18971                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 18972 000009A1 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 18973                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 18974 000009A5 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 18975 000009AB 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block

 18977 000009AD 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 18978 000009B1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller

 19008                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19009                                  ;
 19010                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19011                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19012                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19013                                  ;
 19014                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19015                                  ;
 19016                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19017                                  
 19018                                  AllocHMA:
 19019                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19020                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19021                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19022                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19023                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.

 19025                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19026                                  ;

 19029                                  ;	push	ax
 19030                                  ;	popf

 19177                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19178                                  ;
 19179                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19180                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19181                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19182                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19183                                  ;
 19184                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19185                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19186                                  ;
 19187                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19188                                  
 19189                                  StartVDHead:
 19190                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19191                                  
 19192 00000A3E 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19193 00000A42 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19194 00000A44 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19195 00000A46 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19196 00000A48 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19197                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19198 00000A49 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19199                                  VDiskSig1:
 19200 00000A50 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19201                                  
 19202                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19203                                  
 19204 00000A55 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19205                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19206 00000A5B 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19207 00000A6A 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19208 00000A6C 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19209                                  VDInt19:
 19210 00000A6D EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19211                                  OldVDInt19:
 19212 00000A6E 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19213                                  
 19214                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19215                                  
 19216                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19217 00000A72 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19218                                  VDiskSig2:
 19219 00000A75 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19220                                  
 19221                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19222                                  
 19223 00000A7A 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19224 00000A7D 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19225 00000A7F 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19226 00000A80 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19227 00000A82 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19228 00000A83 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19229 00000A85 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19230 00000A87 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19231 00000A88 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19232 00000A8A 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19233 00000A8C 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19234 00000A8E 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19235 00000A90 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19236                                  
 19237                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 19240                                  ;
 19241                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19242                                  ;
 19243                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19244                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19245                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19246                                  ;
 19247                                  ; Inputs : None
 19248                                  ;
 19249                                  ; Outputs : None
 19250                                  ;
 19251                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19252                                  ;
 19253                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19254                                  
 19255                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19256                                  
 19257                                  InstVDiskHeader:

 19268                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19269 00000AA0 2EA3[700A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19270                                  
 19271                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19272                                  
 19273 00000AA4 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19274                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19275                                  	; 23/10/2022

 19277 00000AA9 CD21                    	int	21h
 19278                                  
 19279                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19280                                  
 19281 00000AAB 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19282 00000AAC 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19283                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19284 00000AAE 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19285                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19286 00000AB5 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19287 00000ABC 40                      	inc	ax
 19288 00000ABD 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19289

 19291

 19373                                  
 19374                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19375                                  
 19376                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19377                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19378                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19379                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19380                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19381                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19382                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19383                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19384                                  ;								      ;I070
 19385                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19386                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19387                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19388                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19389                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19390                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19391                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19392                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19393                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19394                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19395                                  ;								      ;I070
 19396                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19397                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19398                                  
 19399                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19400                                  	; ds = cs
 19401                                  
 19402 00000B3C 06                      	push	es
 19403 00000B3D 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs

 19405 00000B41 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 19406 00000B43 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 19407 00000B45 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19408 00000B47 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19409 00000B49 05[1C0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 19410 00000B4C 80D200                  	adc	dl,0

 19413                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 19414                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax

 19439                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.

 19442                                  ;		the offset.

 19529 00000BC2 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0

 20396                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20397                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20398                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20399                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20400                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20401                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20402                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20403                                  ;
 20404                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20405                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20406                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20407                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20408                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20409                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20410                                  ;
 20411                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20412                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20413                                  ;
 20414                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20415                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20416                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20417                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20418                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20419                                  ;
 20420                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20421                                  ;
 20422                                  ;			  none.
 20423                                  
 20424                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20425                                  ;
 20426                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20427                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20428                                  
 20429                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20430

 20630                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20631                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20632                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 20633                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20634                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20635                                  ;
 20636                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20637                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20638                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20639                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20640                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20641                                  ; program).
 20642                                  
 20643                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20644                                  
 20645                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20646                                  
 20647 00001039 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20648                                  
 20649                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20650                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20651                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20652                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20653                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20654                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20655                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20656                                  ; carridge return.
 20657                                  
 20658                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20659                                  ;character after =.
 20660                                  
 20661 0000103A 06                      	push	es
 20662 0000103B 1E                      	push	ds
 20663 0000103C 07                      	pop	es
 20664 0000103D 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20665 0000103E 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20666                                  
 20667 00001040 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20668 00001042 FC                      	cld
 20669 00001043 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20670 00001049 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20671                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20672 0000104C AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20673 0000104D 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20674 0000104F 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20675 00001051 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20676                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20677 00001053 AC                      	lodsb
 20678 00001054 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20679 00001057 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20680 00001059 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 20681 0000105B FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 20682 0000105D 47                      	inc	di
 20683 0000105E EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 20684                                  done_installparm:
 20685 00001060 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 20686 00001065 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 20687 00001068 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 20688 0000106A 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 20689                                  					; starts with cr.
 20690                                  install_seg_set:
 20691 00001070 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 20692 00001077 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.

 20737 00001098 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 20738 00001099 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 20739                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 20740                                  
 20741                                  ;----------------------------------------
 20742                                  
 20743                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 20744                                  
 20745                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20746                                  
 20747                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 20748 0000109E 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 20749 0000109F 06                      	push	es
 20750 000010A0 1E                      	push	ds
 20751 000010A1 07                      	pop	es
 20752 000010A2 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 20753 000010A3 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 20754                                  
 20755 000010A5 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 20756 000010A6 E8AE22                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 20757 000010A9 5E                      	pop	si
 20758                                  
 20759                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20760                                  	;jmp	short sysinitptr_retn ; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1140h)
 20761                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20762                                  	; ds = cs
 20763 000010AA C3                      	retn
 20764                                  
 20765                                  install_exit_ret:
 20766                                  	;retn		; retn (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1283h) ; 18/12/2022
 20767                                  
 20768                                  	; 24/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 20769                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 20770 000010AB B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh
 20771 000010AD CD21                    	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 20772 000010AF 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3
 20773 000010B2 7404                    	jz      short sysinitptr_retn
 20774 000010B4 E89316                  	call    error_line
 20775 000010B7 F9                      	stc
 20776                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)
 20777 000010B8 C3                      	retn

 20779                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20780                                  
 20781                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 20782                                  ;
 20783                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 20784                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 20785                                  ;
 20786                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 20787                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 20788                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 20789                                  
 20790                                  ParaRound:
 20791 000010B9 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20792 000010BC D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 20793 000010BE D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20794 000010C0 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20795 000010C2 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20796 000010C4 C3                      	retn
 20797                                  
 20798                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20799                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 20800                                  ;
 20801                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 20802                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 20803                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 20804                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 20805                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 20806                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 20807                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 20808                                  ;
 20809                                  ;in: after relocation,
 20810                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 20811                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 20812                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 20813                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 20814                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 20815                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 20816                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 20817                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 20818                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 20819                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 20820                                  ;
 20821                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 20822                                  
 20823                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20824                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20825                                  sysinit_base:				
 20826 000010C5 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 20827 000010CA 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 20828 000010CF CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 20829 000010D1 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 20830 000010D6 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 20831 000010DB 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 20832 000010DC 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 20833 000010DD 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 20834                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 20835                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 20836 000010DF E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 20837 000010E2 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 20838 000010E7 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 20839                                  
 20840                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 20841                                  
 20842 000010E9 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20843 000010EB 0E                      	push	cs
 20844 000010EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 20845 000010ED BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20846 000010F0 CD21                    	int	21h
 20847                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20848                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20849                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20850                                  _stall: 
 20851                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20852 000010F2 F4                      	hlt 
 20853                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20854                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 20855 000010F3 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 20856                                  
 20857                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 20858 000010F5 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 20859                                  
 20860                                  ;-------------------------------------
 20861                                  
 20862                                  sum_up:
 20863                                  
 20864                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 20865                                  ;out:  ax - result
 20866                                  ;
 20867                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 20868                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 20869                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 20870                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 20871                                  ;
 20872                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 20873                                  
 20874 000010FA 1E                      	push	ds
 20875                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 20876                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20877 000010FB 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 20878 000010FF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20879 00001101 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 20880 00001103 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20881 00001105 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 20882                                  					;whole test better fail.
 20883 0000110A D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 20884 0000110C 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 20885                                  sum1:
 20886 0000110E 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 20887 00001110 46                      	inc	si
 20888 00001111 46                      	inc	si
 20889 00001112 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 20890                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 20891                                  sum_sys_code:
 20892                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20893 00001114 BE1411                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20894                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 20895                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 20896                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 20897                                  	; 02/11/2022
 20898                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 20899                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 20900                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 20901 00001117 B9[E038]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 20902 0000111A 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 20903 0000111C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 20904                                  sum2:
 20905 0000111E 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 20906 00001121 46                      	inc	si
 20907 00001122 46                      	inc	si
 20908 00001123 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 20909 00001125 1F                      	pop	ds
 20910 00001126 C3                      	retn
 20911                                  
 20912                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20913                                  
 20914                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 20915                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 20916 00001127 0000                    	dw	0
 20917                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 20918                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 20919 00001129 0000                    	dw	0
 20920                                  
 20921                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 20922                                  
 20923                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 20924

 20927 0000112D 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 20927 00001136 6C6F636174696F6E20-

 20933                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20934                                  ; Set_Buffer
 20935                                  ;
 20936                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 20937                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 20938                                  ;
 20939                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 20940                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 20941                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 20942                                  ;
 20943                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 20944                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 20945                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 20947                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20948                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)

 20950                                  set_buffer:
 20951 00001146 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 20952 00001148 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 20953 0000114B 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 20954 0000114D B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 20955                                  set_buff_1:
 20956                                  	; 25/10/2022
 20957                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 20958 0000114F 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 20959                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 20960 00001151 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 20961                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 20962 00001154 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 20963                                  
 20964 00001159 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 20965 0000115B 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 20966 00001160 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 20967                                  
 20968                                  ;	for each buffer
 20969                                  
 20970                                  nxt_buff:
 20971 00001161 E86300                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 20972 00001164 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 20973 00001166 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 20974                                  
 20975 00001168 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 20976                                  
 20977 0000116D 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 20978                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 20979 0000116E 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 20980 00001171 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 20981                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 20982                                  	; 25/10/2022
 20983 00001173 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 20984                                  
 20985 00001177 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 20986 00001179 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 20987                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 20988 0000117B C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 20989 0000117F 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 20990                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 20991 00001183 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 20992                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 20993 00001188 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 20994 0000118B 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 20995                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 20996 0000118F 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 20997                                  set_buff_2:
 20998 00001192 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 20999                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 21000 00001197 2E800E[2E14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 21001                                  	;call	round
 21002                                  	;retn
 21003                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21004 0000119D E9201F                  	jmp	round

 21006                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21007                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21008                                  ;
 21009                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21010                                  ;
 21011                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21012                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21013                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21014                                  
 21015                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21016                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21017 000011A0 53                      	push	bx
 21018 000011A1 52                      	push	dx
 21019 000011A2 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21020 000011A6 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21021                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21022 000011AB 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21023                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21024                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21025                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21026 000011AE 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21027 000011B0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21028 000011B2 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21029                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21030 000011B5 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21031 000011B7 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21032 000011BA 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21033 000011BC BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21034                                  	;zf=1
 21035                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21036                                  	;zf=1
 21037 000011BF 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21038                                  got_hma:
 21039 000011C4 5A                      	pop	dx
 21040 000011C5 5B                      	pop	bx
 21041 000011C6 C3                      	retn

 21050                                  ;    ax = di
 21051                                  ;
 21052                                  ;out:
 21053                                  ;    above entries set.

 21056 000011C7 2EFF36[3903]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 21057                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 21058 000011CC 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21059 000011D0 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21060 000011D4 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 21061                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21062 000011D9 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax

 21064 000011DC 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh

 21066 000011E2 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21067                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21068 000011E8 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 21069 000011EE C3                      	retn

 21071                                  ; ======================================================================
 21072                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21073                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21074                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21075                                  
 21076                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21077                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21078                                  ;
 21079                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21080                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21081                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21082                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21083                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21084                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21085                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21086                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21087                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21088                                  ;
 21089                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21090                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21091                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21092                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21093                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21094                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21095                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21096                                  ;	conditions:
 21097                                  ;
 21098                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21099                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21100                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21101                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21102                                  ;
 21103                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21104                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21105                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21106                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21107                                  ;
 21108                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21109                                  ;
 21110                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21111                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21112                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21113                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21114                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21115                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21116                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21117                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21118                                  ;
 21119                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21120                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21121                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21122                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21123                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21124                                  ;
 21125                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21126                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21127                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21128                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21129                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21130                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21131                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21132                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21133                                  ;
 21134                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21135                                  
 21136                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21137                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21138                                  
 21139                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21140                                  stackinit:
 21141 000011EF 50                      	push	ax
 21142 000011F0 1E                      	push	ds
 21143 000011F1 06                      	push	es
 21144 000011F2 53                      	push	bx
 21145 000011F3 51                      	push	cx
 21146 000011F4 52                      	push	dx
 21147 000011F5 57                      	push	di
 21148 000011F6 56                      	push	si
 21149 000011F7 55                      	push	bp
 21150                                  
 21151                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21152                                  
 21153                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21154                                  	; ds = cs
 21155 000011F8 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21156 000011FB 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21157                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21158                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21159                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21160 000011FD 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21161                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21162 00001201 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21163 00001204 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21164                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21165 00001208 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21166                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21167                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21168                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21169 0000120B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21170                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21171 0000120F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21172 00001211 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21173                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21174                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21175                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21176 00001214 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21177                                  
 21178                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21179                                  
 21180                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21181                                  
 21182                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21183                                  	; 12/12/2022

 21970                                  
 21971                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21972                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21973                                  
 21974                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21975                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 21976                                  
 21977                                  new_init_loop:
 21978                                  
 21979                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 21980                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 21981                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 21982                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 21983                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 21984                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 21985                                  
 21986 000013E4 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 21987 000013E7 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 21988 000013E9 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 21989 000013ED 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 21990                                  
 21991 000013F0 1E                      	push	ds
 21992                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 21993                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 21994                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21995 000013F1 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 21996 000013F4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 21997 000013F6 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 21998 000013F9 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 21999 000013FB 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22000 000013FF 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22001 00001402 1F                      	pop	ds
 22002                                  
 22003 00001403 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22004 00001406 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22005 0000140A C3                      	retn
 22006                                  
 22007                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22008                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22009                                  
 22010                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22011                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22012                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22013                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22014                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22015                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22016                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22017                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22018                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22019                                  
 22020                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22021                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22022                                  
 22023                                  setdevmark:
 22024                                  
 22025 0000140B 06                      	push	es
 22026 0000140C 51                      	push	cx
 22027                                  
 22028 0000140D 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22029 00001412 2E890E[2C14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22030 00001417 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22031                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22032                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22033 00001419 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22034 0000141D 41                      	inc	cx
 22035                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22036 0000141E 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22037                                  
 22038 00001423 59                      	pop	cx
 22039 00001424 07                      	pop	es
 22040 00001425 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22041 0000142A C3                      	retn

 22268                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22269                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22270                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22271                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22272                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22273                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22274                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22275                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22276                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22277                                  
 22278                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22279                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22280 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22281 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22282 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22283                                  endstruc
 22284                                  
 22285                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22286                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22287                                  ;
 22288                                  ;
 22289                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22290                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22291                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22292                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22293                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22294                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22295                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22296                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22297                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22298                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22299                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22300                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22301                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22302                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22303                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22304                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22305                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22306                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22307                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22308                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22309                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22310                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22311                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22312                                  ;	   :
 22313                                  ;
 22314                                  ;Note:
 22315                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22316                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22317                                  ;
 22318                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22319                                  ;
 22320                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22321                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22322                                  ;
 22323                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22324                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22325                                  ;
 22326                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22327                                  ;
 22328                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22329                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22330                                  ;
 22331                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22332                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22333                                  ;
 22334                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22335                                  ;
 22336                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22337                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22338                                  ;
 22339                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22340                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22341                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22342                                  ;
 22343                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22344                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22345                                  ;
 22346                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22347                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22348                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22349                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22350                                  
 22351                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22352                                  
 22353                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22354                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22355                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22356                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22357                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22358                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22359                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22360                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22361                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22362                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22363                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22364                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22365                                  
 22366                                  ;**** Function flags
 22367                                  
 22368                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22369                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22370                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22371                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22372                                  
 22373                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22374                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22375 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22376 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22377 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22378 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22379 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22380 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22381                                  endstruc
 22382                                  
 22383                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22384                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22385                                  ;
 22386                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22387                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22388                                  ;	     +-
 22389                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22390                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22391                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22392                                  ;	     |	:
 22393                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22394                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22395                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22396                                  ;	     |	:
 22397                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22398                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22399                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22400                                  ;	     +-	:
 22401                                  ;
 22402                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22403                                  ;
 22404                                  ;Note:
 22405                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22406                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22407                                  ;
 22408                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22409                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22410                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22411                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22412                                  
 22413                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22414                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22415                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22416                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22417                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22418                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22419                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22420                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22421                                  
 22422                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22423 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22424 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22425 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22426 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22427 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22428                                  endstruc
 22429                                  
 22430                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22431                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22432                                  ;
 22433                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22434                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22435                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22436                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22437                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22438                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22439                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22440                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22441                                  ;
 22442                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22443                                  ;
 22444                                  ;            +-
 22445                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22446                                  ;	    | or
 22447                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22448                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22449                                  ;	    | or
 22450                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22451                                  ;	    | or
 22452                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22453                                  ;	    | or
 22454                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22455                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22456                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22457                                  ;	    | or
 22458                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22459                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22460                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22461                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22462                                  ;	    +-
 22463                                  ;
 22464                                  ;
 22465                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22466                                  ;      list.
 22467                                  ;
 22468                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22469                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22470                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22471                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22472                                  
 22473                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22474                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22475 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22476 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22477 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22478 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22479                                  endstruc

 22486                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 22487                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 22488                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 22489                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 22490                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 22491                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 22492                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 22493                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String

 22500

 22503                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 22504                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 22505                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22506                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22507                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22508                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22509                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22510                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line
