 22594                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22595                                  ; SysParse;
 22596                                  ;
 22597                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22598                                  ;
 22599                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22600                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22601                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22602                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22603                                  ;
 22604                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22605                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22606                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22607                                  ;
 22608                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22609                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22610                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22611                                  ;
 22612                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22613                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22614                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22615                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22616                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22617                                  ;
 22618                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22619                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22620                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22621                                  ;
 22622                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22623                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22624                                  ;
 22625                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22626                                  ;
 22627                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22628                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22629                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22630                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22631                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22632                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22633                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22634                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22635                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22636                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22637                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22638                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22639                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22640                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22641                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22642                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22643                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22644                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22645                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22646                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22647                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22648                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22649                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22650                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22651                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22652                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22653                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22654                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22655                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22656                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22657                                  
 22658                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22659                                  
 22660                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22661                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22662                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22663                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22664                                  
 22665                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22666                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22667                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22668                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22669                                  ;
 22670                                  
 22671                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22672                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22673                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22674                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22675                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22676                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22677                                  
 22678                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22679                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22680                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22681                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22682                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22683                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22684                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22685                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22686                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22687                                  
 22688                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22689                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22690                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other

 23000                                  ; _$P_Chk_Pos_Control
 23001                                  ;
 23002                                  ; Function: Parse CONTROL block for a positional
 23003                                  ;
 23004                                  ; Input:     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23005                                  ;	     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23006                                  ;
 23007                                  ; Output:    None
 23008                                  ;
 23009                                  ; Use:	 _$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 23010                                  ;
 23011                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(W), _$P_RC(W)
 23012                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23013                                  
 23014                                  _$P_Chk_Pos_Control:
 23015 00001654 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23016                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Match_Flag] ;AN000;
 23017 00001655 268B07                  	mov	ax,[es:bx]
 23018                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23019 00001658 A802                    	test	al,_$P_Repeat
 23020                                  	;test	ax,_$P_Repeat		;AN000; repeat allowed ?
 23021 0000165A 7505                    	jnz	short _$P_CPC00		;AN000; then do not increment ORDINAL
 23022                                  
 23023 0000165C 2EFF06[3314]            	inc	word [cs:_$P_ORDINAL]	;AC034; update the ordinal

 23219                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23220                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23221                                  ;
 23222                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23223                                  ;
 23224                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23225                                  ;	    AL = type
 23226                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23227                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23228                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23229                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23230                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23231                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23232                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23233                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23234                                  ;
 23235                                  ; Output:   None
 23236                                  ;
 23237                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23238                                  ;

 23240                                  ;***********************************************************************

 23609                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23610                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23611                                  ;
 23612                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23613                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23614                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23615                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23616                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23617                                  ;
 23618                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23619                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 23621                                  ; Output:    None

 23624                                  ;

 23626                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23627                                  
 23628                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23629                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 23630                                  
 23631                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 23632 000018D3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23633 000018D4 2E800E[4114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 23634 000018DA 2E8026[4114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 23635 000018E0 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 23636 000018E3 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 23637 000018E5 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 23638

 23641                                  
 23642 000018EB 2E800E[4114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 23643                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 23644 000018F1 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 23645                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;

 24538 00001C84 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 24539                                  
 24540 00001C86 2E800E[4114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 24541                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 24542                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 24543 00001C8C 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 24544 00001C8E EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24545                                  
 24546                                  
 24547                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24548                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24549                                  ;
 24550                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24551                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24552                                  ;
 24553                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24554                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24555                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24556                                  ;
 24557                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24558                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24559                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24560                                  
 24561                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24562                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24563                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24564                                  ;
 24565                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24566                                  
 24567                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24568                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24569                                  
 24570                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24571                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24572 00001C90 8D2E[4A14]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24573                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24574 00001C94 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24575 00001C96 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24576                                  
 24577                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24578 00001C98 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24579 00001C9A 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24580                                  
 24581 00001C9C F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24582                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24583                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24584 00001C9D C3                      	retn
 24585                                  
 24586                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24587                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24588                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24589                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24590                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24591                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24592                                  
 24593                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24594                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24595 00001C9E 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24596 00001CA0 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24597                                  
 24598 00001CA2 2E800E[4114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24599                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24600                                  
 24601                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24602                                  	; cf=0
 24603                                  	;retn
 24604                                  
 24605                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24606                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24607                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24608 00001CA8 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24609                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24610                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24611 00001CA9 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24612                                  
 24613                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24614                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24615                                  ;
 24616                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24617                                  ;
 24618                                  ;  Input:
 24619                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24620                                  ;
 24621                                  ;  Output:
 24622                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24623                                  ;
 24624                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24625                                  ;
 24626                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24627                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24628                                  
 24629                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24630 00001CAA 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24631 00001CAB 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24632 00001CAC 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24633                                  	
 24634 00001CAD 2E833E[3E14]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24635 00001CB3 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24636                                  
 24637 00001CB5 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24638 00001CB6 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24639 00001CB7 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24640 00001CB8 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24641 00001CB9 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24642 00001CBA 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24643 00001CBB 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24644 00001CBC 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24645 00001CBE 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 24646 00001CC0 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24647 00001CC3 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24648                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24649 00001CC5 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24650 00001CC7 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24651 00001CC9 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24652 00001CCA 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24653 00001CCB 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24654 00001CCC 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24655 00001CCD 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24656 00001CCE 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24657 00001CCF 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24658 00001CD0 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24659                                  
 24660                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24661 00001CD2 2E8936[3C14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24662 00001CD7 2E891E[3E14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24663                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24664 00001CDC 2E8B36[3C14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24665 00001CE1 2E8E1E[3E14]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24666                                  
 24667                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24668 00001CE6 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24669 00001CE9 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24670                                  
 24671 00001CEB 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24672 00001CED 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24673                                  
 24674 00001CEF 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24675 00001CF2 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24676                                  
 24677 00001CF4 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24678 00001CF5 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24679                                  
 24680                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24681 00001CF7 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24682 00001CF8 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24683                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24684 00001CF9 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24685                                  
 24686                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24687                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24688                                  	; cf=0
 24689                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24690                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24691 00001CFB 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24692 00001CFC 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24693 00001CFD 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 24694 00001CFE C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25248                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25249                                  
 25250                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25251                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25252                                  
 25253                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25254                                  ;
 25255                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25256                                  ;
 25257                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25258                                  ;
 25259                                  ;   Modification log:
 25260                                  ;
 25261                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25262                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25263                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25264                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25265                                  ;
 25266                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25267                                  ;
 25268                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25269                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25270                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25271                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25272                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25273                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25274                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25275                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25276                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25277                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25278                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25279                                  ;
 25280                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25281                                  
 25282                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25283                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25284                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25285                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25286                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25287                                  
 25288                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25289                                  
 25290                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25291                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25292                                  
 25293                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25294                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25295                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25296                                  
 25297                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25298                                  ;
 25299                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25300                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25301                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25302                                  ;	           line.
 25303                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25304                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25305                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25306                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25307                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25308                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25309                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25310                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25311                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25312                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25313                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25314                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25315                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25316                                  ;	           for details).
 25317                                  
 25318                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25319                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25320                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25321                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25322                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25323                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25324                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25325                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25326                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25327                                  
 25328                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25329                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25330                                  
 25331                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25332                                  
 25333                                  %endif
 25334                                  
 25335                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****

 25344                                  
 25345 00001EE2 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25346 00001EE4 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25347 00001EE6 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25348 00001EE8 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25349 00001EEC 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25350                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25351                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25352                                  ;

 25355 00001EF3 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)

 25382                                  
 25383                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25384                                  
 25385                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25386                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 25387                                  
 25388                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25389                                  ;
 25390                                  ; procedure : doconf
 25391                                  ;
 25392                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 25393                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 25394                                  ;
 25395                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25396                                  
 25397                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25398                                  doconf:
 25399 00001F15 0E                      	push	cs
 25400 00001F16 1F                      	pop	ds
 25401                                  
 25402 00001F17 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 25403                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 25404 00001F1A CD21                    	int	21h
 25405 00001F1C 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 25406                                  
 25407                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25408                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25409                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 25410                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 25411                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25412                                  
 25413 00001F20 BA[FC33]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 25414 00001F23 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 25415                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 25416 00001F26 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25417 00001F27 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25418 00001F29 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 25419                                  
 25420                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25421                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25422                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 25423                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 25424                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 25425 00001F2B C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 25426 00001F30 C3                      	retn
 25427                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 25428 00001F31 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 25429 00001F33 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25430 00001F35 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25431                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 25432 00001F37 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 25433 00001F3A CD21                    	int	21h
 25434 00001F3C A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 25435                                  
 25436 00001F3F 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25437                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 25438 00001F41 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 25439 00001F44 CD21                    	int	21h
 25440                                  
 25441                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25442                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25443 00001F46 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25444                                  
 25445 00001F4A A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25446 00001F4D A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25447 00001F50 E866F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25448 00001F53 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25449                                  
 25450                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25451                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25452                                  ;;
 25453                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25454                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25455                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25456                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25457                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25458                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25459                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25460                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25461                                  ;;
 25462                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25463                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25464                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25465                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25466                                  
 25467 00001F55 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25468                                  	
 25469                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25470                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx

 25591                                  %if 0

 25596                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 25597                                  
 25598                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code

 25600                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 25601                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 25602                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25603                                  
 25604                                          push    ax                      ;
 25605                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25606                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25607                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25608                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25609                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25610                                          pop     ax
 25611                                  ;
 25612                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25613                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25614                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25615                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25616                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25617                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25618                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25619                                  ;   spot.
 25620                                  ;
 25621                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25622                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25623                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25624                                  ;   retrieved.
 25625                                  ;
 25626                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?

 25635                                  not_final:                              ;
 25636                                  ;endif
 25637                                  
 25638                                  %endif

 25760                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst

 25763                                  
 25764                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 25765                                          int     21h                     ; get link state

 25767                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 25768

 25772

 25774                                  
 25775                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 25776                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 25777                                          int     21h

 25780                                          int     21h
 25781                                  
 25782                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 25783                                  
 25784                                  %endif

 25802                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25803                                  ; buffer command
 25804                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25805                                  
 25806                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25807                                  ;									      *
 25808                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 25809                                  ;									      *
 25810                                  ; input :								      *
 25811                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 25812                                  ; output:								      *
 25813                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 25814                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 25815                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 25816                                  ;									      *
 25817                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 25818                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 25819                                  ; logic:								      *
 25820                                  ; {									      *
 25821                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 25822                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 25823                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 25824                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 25825                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 25826                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 25827                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 25828                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 25829                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 25830                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 25831                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 25832                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 25833                                  ;	};								      *
 25834                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 25835                                  ; };									      *
 25836                                  ;									      *
 25837                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25838                                  
 25839                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25840                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 25841                                  tryb:
 25842 0000204E 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 25843 00002051 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 25844                                  
 25845                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25846                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25847                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25848                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25849                                  ;;endif
 25850                                  
 25851                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25852                                  	; 18/12/2022
 25853 00002053 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25854                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 25855 00002055 880E[461D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 25856                                  
 25857 00002059 BF[FF1C]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 25858                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 25859                                  	; 04/01/2023
 25860                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 25861                                  do7:
 25862 0000205C E87D06                  	call	sysinit_parse
 25863 0000205F 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 25864                                  	; 04/01/2023
 25865                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 25866                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 25867                                  	; 31/12/2022
 25868                                  ;sr7:
 25869                                  	;jmp	coff
 25870                                  	; 04/01/2023
 25871 00002061 E9F605                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 25872                                  if7:
 25873 00002064 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 25874 00002067 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 25875                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 25876 00002069 813E[4A1D][3F1D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x

 25878                                  	; 31/12/2022
 25879 0000206F 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 25880                                  
 25881                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 25882                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 25883                                  if11:
 25884                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 25885 00002071 A1[4C1D]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]
 25886 00002074 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1
 25887 00002077 7505                    	jne	short if13

 25890                                  	;jmp	short en11

 25907                                  if18:
 25908 00002095 A1[421D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.
 25909 00002098 A3[9702]                	mov	[buffers],ax	; now,let's set it really.
 25910

 25912 0000209E A3[9902]                	mov	[h_buffers],ax

 25925                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25926                                  ; break command
 25927                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25928                                  
 25929                                  ;****************************************************************************
 25930                                  ;									    *
 25931                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 25932                                  ;									    *
 25933                                  ; input :								    *
 25934                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 25935                                  ; output:								    *
 25936                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 25937                                  ;									    *
 25938                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 25939                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 25940                                  ; logic:								    *
 25941                                  ; {									    *
 25942                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 25943                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 25944                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 25945                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 25946                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 25947                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 25948                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 25949                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *

 26015                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26016                                  ;									      *
 26017                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 26018                                  ;									      *
 26019                                  ; input :								      *
 26020                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26021                                  ; output:								      *
 26022                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 26023                                  ;									      *
 26024                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *

 27265                                  ;	     set num_cds to the returned value; 			      *
 27266                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						      *
 27267                                  ;	     error exit;						      *
 27268                                  ;	};								      *
 27269                                  ; };									      *
 27270                                  ;									      *
 27271                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27272

 27341                                  ; returns, and setparms as coded now can return with carry set. 
 27342                                  ;       jc	short trypbad

 27350                                  trypbad:
 27351 00002541 E9BB01                  	jmp	badop
 27352                                  
 27353                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27354                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27355                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27356                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27357                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27358                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27359                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27360                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27361                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27362                                  
 27363                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27364                                  ;									  *
 27365                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27366                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27367                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27368                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27369                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27370                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27371                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27372                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27373                                  ; input :								  *
 27374                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27375                                  ; output:								  *
 27376                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27377                                  ;									  *
 27378                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27379                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27380                                  ; logic:								  *
 27381                                  ; {									  *
 27382                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27383                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27384                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27385                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27386                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27387                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27388                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27389                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *

 27831                                  ;***********************************************************************

 27835                                  ; when we need to set system data flag,use this command.	       *
 27836                                  ;								       *
 27837                                  ; input :							       *
 27838                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.			       *

 28070                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28071                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28072                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28073                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28074                                  ;
 28075                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28076                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28077                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28078                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28079                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28080                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28081                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28082                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28083                                  ;	 procedure.
 28084                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28085                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28086                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal

 28413                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28414                                  ;
 28415                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28416                                  ;
 28417                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28418                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28419                                  ;
 28420                                  ;	Output : none
 28421                                  ;
 28422                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28423                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28424                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28425                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28426                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28427                                  ;
 28428                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28429                                  
 28430                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28431                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28432                                  	; ds = cs
 28433 0000279C A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 28434                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 28435                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28436 0000279F E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28437 000027A2 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28438                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28439                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28440                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28441                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28442                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28443                                  	; ds = cs
 28444 000027A4 803E[FF1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28445 000027A9 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28446 000027AB A1[E61E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28447                                  lim_set:
 28448                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28449                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28450                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28451                                  ;limx:
 28452                                  	;retn
 28453                                  	
 28454                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28455                                  
 28456                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28457                                  ;
 28458                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28459                                  ;
 28460                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28461                                  ;	Output : none
 28462                                  ;
 28463                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28464                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28465                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28466                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28467                                  ;
 28468                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28469                                  
 28470                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28471                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28472 000027AE 1E                      	push	ds
 28473 000027AF BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28474 000027B2 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28475 000027B4 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28476 000027B8 2E891E[031F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28477 000027BD B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28478 000027BF D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28479 000027C1 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28480 000027C4 2EC606[021F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28481 000027CA 1F                      	pop	ds
 28482                                  ;limx:
 28483 000027CB C3                      	retn
 28484                                  
 28485                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28486                                  ;
 28487                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28488                                  ;
 28489                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28490                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28491                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28492                                  ;
 28493                                  ;	Output : none
 28494                                  ;
 28495                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 28496                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28497                                  ;
 28498                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28499                                  
 28500                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28501                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28502                                  	; ds = cs
 28503 000027CC 803E[021F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28504                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28505                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28506                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28507 000027D1 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28508                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28509 000027D3 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28510 000027D6 8826[021F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28511                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28512                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28513 000027DA 1E                      	push	ds
 28514                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28515 000027DB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28516 000027DD 2EA1[031F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28517 000027E1 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28518 000027E4 1F                      	pop	ds
 28519                                  timx:
 28520 000027E5 C3                      	retn
 28521                                  
 28522                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28523                                  ;
 28524                                  ; procedure : IsIt3Com?
 28525                                  ;
 28526                                  ;	Input : DevEntry = Seg:0 of device driver
 28527                                  ;	Output : Zero flag set if device name is 'PROTMAN$'
 28528                                  ;		 else Zero flag is reset
 28529                                  ;
 28530                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28531                                  
 28532                                  IsIt3Com:
 28533                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28534                                  	; ds = cs
 28535 000027E6 1E                      	push	ds
 28536 000027E7 06                      	push	es
 28537 000027E8 56                      	push	si
 28538                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28539 000027E9 C536[E81E]              	lds	si,[DevEntry]
 28540                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header
 28541 000027ED 83C60A                  	add	si,SYSDEV.NAME ; 10 	; ptr device name
 28542 000027F0 0E                      	push	cs
 28543 000027F1 07                      	pop	es
 28544 000027F2 BF[051F]                	mov	di,ThreeComName
 28545 000027F5 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 28546 000027F8 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 28547 000027FA 5E                      	pop	si
 28548 000027FB 07                      	pop	es
 28549 000027FC 1F                      	pop	ds
 28550 000027FD C3                      	retn
 28551

 28557 000027FF B462                    	mov	ah,62h

 28559 00002803 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx
 28560 00002805 2E8B1E[A302]            	mov	bx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]
 28561                                  	;mov	[2],bx
 28562 0000280A 891E0200                	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],bx
 28563 0000280E 1F                      	pop	ds
 28564 0000280F C3                      	retn

 28572                                  %if 0
 28573                                  
 28574                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28575                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28576                                  
 28577                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28578                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28579                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28580                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28581                                  
 28582                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28583                                  ;
 28584                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28585                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28586                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28587                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28588                                  ;
 28589                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28590                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28591                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28592                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28593                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28594                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28595                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28596                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28597                                  ; available during the load.
 28598                                  ;
 28599                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28600                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28601                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28602                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28603                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28604                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28605                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28606                                  ;
 28607                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28608                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28609                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28610                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28611                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28612                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28613                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28614                                  ;
 28615                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28616                                  
 28617                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28618                                  
 28619                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28620                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28621                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28622                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28623                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28624                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28625                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28626                                  
 28627                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28628                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28629                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28630                                  
 28631                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28632                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 28633                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28634                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 28635                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 28636                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 28637                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 28638                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28639                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 28640                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 28641                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28642                                  
 28643                                  InitVar:
 28644                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 28645                                  	push	ax
 28646                                  	push	cx
 28647                                  	push	di
 28648                                  	push	es
 28649                                  
 28650                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 28651                                  	push	cs
 28652                                  	pop	es
 28653                                  
 28654                                  	xor	ax,ax
 28655                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 28656                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 28657                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 28658                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 28659                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 28660                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 28661                                  
 28662                                  	cld
 28663                                  
 28664                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 28665                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 28666                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 28667                                  
 28668                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 28669                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 28670                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 28671                                  
 28672                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 28673                                  
 28674                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 28675                                  	pop	es
 28676                                  	pop	di
 28677                                  	pop	cx
 28678                                  	pop	ax	 	
 28679                                  
 28680                                  	retn
 28681                                  
 28682                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28683                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 28684                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28685                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 28686                                  ; EXIT    : None
 28687                                  ; ERROR   : None
 28688                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 28689                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28690                                  
 28691                                  FixMem:
 28692                                  	push	ax
 28693                                  	push	bx
 28694                                  	push	cx
 28695                                  	push	dx
 28696                                  	push	es
 28697                                  
 28698                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 28699                                  
 28700                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 28701                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 28702                                  
 28703                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 28704                                  
 28705                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 28706                                  
 28707                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 28708                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 28709                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 28710                                  
 28711                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28712                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 28713                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 28714                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28715                                  
 28716                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 28717                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 28718                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 28719                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 28720                                  
 28721                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 28722
